snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan asserted that the Obama  administration’s foreign policy was “unraveling,” while Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. repeatedly demanded that Mr. Ryan explain what a Romney administration would do differently.
abstract: Paul D Ryan, debating Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr, attempts to portray the Obama administration as having a dangerously unstable foreign policy; Ryan's accusations, often vague, belie fact that the two candidates are largely in line on a number of substantial issues.
lead_paragraph: Representative Paul D. Ryan asserted that the Obama  administration’s foreign policy was “unraveling,” while Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. repeatedly demanded that Mr. Ryan explain what a Romney administration would do differently.

headline.main: On Foreign Policy, Rivals Differing in Style but Often Similar in Substance
headline.print_headline: On Foreign Policy, Rivals Differing in Style but Often Similar in Substance
